intro: Vochysia liscanoi, commonly known as the Liscanó ceiba, is a tropical tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and towering height. The plant produces showy, cream-colored flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Vochysia liscanoi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
